§7. Bullseye tests

Martin R. Smith martin.smith@durham.ac.uk

2020-02-26

Source: vignettes/7-bullseye.Rmd
7-bullseye.Rmd

I implemented ‘bullseye’ tests (Kuhner & Yamato, 2015) by drawing 1 000 n-leaf trees at random from the uniform distribution (using the R function ape::rtree, repeated for n = 5, 10, 20, 50), and using these trees to simulate binary phylogenetic characters under the Jukes-Cantor model (using R function phangorn::simSeq).

subsampling50 miscoding50 subsamplingAccuracy miscodingAccuracy

spr 406 613 0.329 0.721
tbr_l 312 604 0.439 0.837
tbr_u 398 693 0.339 0.840

rfi 638 785 0.643 0.746

path 633 704 0.621 0.600

References

Kuhner, M. K., & Yamato, J. (2015). Practical performance of tree comparison metrics. Systematic Biology, 64(2), 205–214. doi:10.1093/sysbio/syu085
